problem: If $3^{x}=4$, $4^{y}=5$, $5^{z}=6$, and $6^{w}=7$, find the value of $x \cdot y \cdot z \cdot w$.
solution: To find $x \cdot y \cdot z \cdot w$, we consider the chain of exponentiations: \[ 3^{x \cdot y \cdot z \cdot w} = \left(\left(\left(3^x\right)^y\right)^z\right)^w = \left(\left(4^y\right)^z\right)^w = \left(5^z\right)^w = 6^w = 7 = 3^{\log_3 7}, \] so $x \cdot y \cdot z \cdot w = \log_3 7$. Thus, $x \cdot y \cdot z \cdot w = \boxed{\log_3 7}$.
